title: NIPS_2001_11_abs

sentences.text: A mixed-signal paradigm is presented for high-resolution parallel inner-product computation in very high dimensions , suitable for efficient implementation of kernels in image processing .
At the core of the externally digital architecture is a high-density , low-power analog array performing binary-binary partial matrix-vector multiplication .
Full digital resolution is maintained even with low-resolution analog-to-digital conversion , owing to random statistics in the analog summation of binary products .
A random modulation scheme produces near-Bernoulli statistics even for highly correlated inputs .
The approach is validated with real image data , and with experimental results from a CID/DRAM analog array prototype in 0.5 cents m CMOS .

summary: A mixed-signal paradigm is presented for high-resolution parallel inner-product computation in very high dimensions , suitable for efficient implementation of kernels in image processing . At the core of the externally digital architecture is a high-density , low-power analog array performing binary-binary partial matrix-vector multiplication . Full digital resolution is maintained even with low-resolution analog-to-digital conversion , owing to random statistics in the analog summation of binary products . A random modulation scheme produces near-Bernoulli statistics even for highly correlated inputs . The approach is validated with real image data , and with experimental results from a CID/DRAM analog array prototype in 0.5 cents m CMOS .

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates a relationship where the subject provides or offers something to someone or something else. In this context, it suggests that the subject (A mixed-signal paradigm) makes available or demonstrates its capabilities for performing high-resolution parallel inner-product computation.

Predicate-is_suitable_for.label: is suitable for
Predicate-is_suitable_for.description: The predicate 'is suitable for' indicates a relationship between two entities where the subject has inherent properties or characteristics that make it well-suited to perform, facilitate, or achieve the object. In general, this predicate suggests compatibility, effectiveness, and appropriateness of the subject in relation to the object.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' indicates a state of being or equivalence between the subject and object. It establishes an identity relationship, suggesting that the subject and object share similar characteristics, properties, or attributes.

Predicate-is_maintained_even_with.label: is maintained even with
Predicate-is_maintained_even_with.description: The predicate 'is maintained even with' indicates that despite the presence of a potential obstacle or limitation (object), the subject is able to maintain its integrity, quality, or functionality. This suggests a relationship where the object does not compromise or undermine the subject's ability to function as intended.

Predicate-produces.label: produces
Predicate-produces.description: The predicate 'produces' indicates a causal relationship between its subject and object, suggesting that the subject generates or brings into existence the described state or characteristic of the object. In this sense, it implies an input-output relation where the subject's properties or actions lead to the creation or emergence of the object's characteristics.

Predicate-even_for.label: even for
Predicate-even_for.description: The predicate 'even for' indicates that a subject can successfully handle or accommodate an object despite potential difficulties or challenges. It suggests that the subject has the ability to adapt, tolerate, or overcome obstacles related to the object.

Predicate-is_validated_with.label: is validated with
Predicate-is_validated_with.description: This predicate indicates that a subject (e.g., an approach, method, or technique) has been tested and confirmed to be effective or accurate through its association with a specific object (e.g., data, criteria, or standards). The connection between the subject and object suggests a process of evaluation, verification, or authentication, implying that the subject's quality, reliability, or validity is ensured by being linked to the object.

Predicate-is_validated_by.label: is validated by
Predicate-is_validated_by.description: Indicates that a subject's validity or correctness is supported or confirmed by an object. The predicate 'is validated by' establishes a connection between the subject and the object, suggesting that the object serves as evidence, authority, or standard for verifying the truthfulness of the subject.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: Indicates that a subject employs or exploits an object to achieve some purpose or effect. The predicate 'uses' establishes a relationship between the subject and the object, suggesting that the subject leverages the properties, capabilities, or resources of the object to accomplish something.

Predicate-maintains.label: maintains
Predicate-maintains.description: The predicate 'maintains' indicates a relationship where the subject ensures or upholds the existence, quality, or functionality of the object. It implies that the subject takes responsibility for preserving or sustaining the state, properties, or characteristics described by the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is a specific instance or subclass of the object concept. It establishes a hierarchical relationship between the two, where the subject is more detailed and focused than the object.
